Award.AwardTitle: 2013 CPS PI Meeting and CY 2013-CY 2014 Workshops on CPS Energy, CPS Transportation, CPS Agriculture, and CPS Medical Devices

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration: The focus of this proposal is to provide technical coordination for the 2013 Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS) Principal Investigators' (PI) meeting and multiple CPS-related workshops in the areas of Energy, Transportation, Medical Devices, and Agriculture in late 2013 and early 2014. The workshops, each comprising 50-60 leading academic researchers and government as well as industrial technology managers, will help the community understand the research challenges at the intersection of cyber-physical systems and these application domains, and help build research agendas for these domains going forward. Technical coordination to be provided includes creating web resources ahead of the PI meeting and workshops; coordination and formulation of the program agendas via planning committees for the events; developing, editing, and archiving content from these meetings; and contributing to the writing, editing, and publishing of research needs reports resulting from these meetings. The broader impact of this project is comprised of the meeting/workshop artifacts, particularly a broad and compelling research agenda to guide future investments in cyber-physical systems R&D, particularly in the areas of energy, transportation, medical devices, and agriculture.

ProgramReference.Text: EXP PROG TO STIM COMP RES

POR.DRECONTENT:
The  major goals of this project were to coordinate and execute the following NSF-sponsored CPS and related activities:

1. The Fourth Annual CPS PI Meeting was held October 17-18, 2013 at the Crystal Gateway Marriott Hotel in Arlington, Virginia.  The primary goal of this meeting was to assemble all active CPS PIs who cover a broad spectrum of CPS R&D to view new developments in CPS foudnations, to identify new, emerging applications, and to discuss technology gaps and barriers. Over 260 persons attended this two-day meeting. Over 150 proejct posters and videos were submitted. Presentations are hyperlinked to the respective speakers on the meeting program agenda. Project data and results are disseminated to the public via the 2013 CPS PI Meeting website at http://cps-vo.org/group/pimtg13.

2. The 2013 NSF National Workshop on Energy CPS was held  December 16-17, 2013 at the Waterview Conference Center in Arlington, Virginia. The goal of the workshop was to assemble stakeholders from industry,  government, and academia to provide perspectives focusing on the blend of the cypber and the physical aspects of energy with the ultmate goal of developing inputs towards long-term CPS research directions for enabling strategic approaches to achieving future cyber-controlled energy infrastructures, including monitoring, control, and protection solutions.  Over 100 persons attended the workshop. The workshop website can be found at http://cps-vo.org/group/CPSEnergyWksp2013.

3. The 2014 NSF National Workshop on Transportation CPS was held on January 23-24, 2014 at teh Waterview Conference Center in Arlington, Virginia. The goal of the workshop was to gather leaders from industry, research labs. academia, and government to assess the current state of transportation CPS and continue discussion on future directions for R&D. Despite recent developments in transportatino CPS technology, the transporttion needs of tomorrow present many challenges that will require breakthrough technology innovations as well as new design approaches. Over 100 persons attended the workshop. The workhshop website can be found at http://cps-vo.org/group/CPSTransportationWksp2014.

4. The 2014 NSF National Workshop on Research Frontiers in Medical CPS February 6-7, 2014 at the Waterview Conference Center in Arlington, Vriginia. The goal of the workshop was to identify research directions and opportunities that, if pursued, can initiate new developments in medical insturmentation, technologies, and approaches to maintaining health and wellbeing and treating illnesses. Close to 100 persons attended the workshop. The workshop website can be found at http://cps-vo.org/2014MedicalCPSWkshp.

5. 2014 NSF Early Career Professionals Workshop on Exploring New Frontiers in CPS held March 13-14, 2014 at the American Geophysical Union in Washington, DC. The goal of the Workshop was to foster innovative and thought provoking discussions exploring new frontiers of CPS by bringing together uppler-level graduate sudents and recent Ph.D graduates. Participation at this unique workshop was prioritized for upper-level graduate students (post Master's Degree) and recent Ph.D. graduates (within one year after the Ph.D. dissertation defense.) Close to 100 persons attended the workshop. The workshop webstie can be found at http://cps-vo.org/group/CPSYoungProfessionals2014.

6. The 2014 NSF CPS Reference Architectures Workshop held March 26, 2014 at the National Science Foundation in Arlington, Virginia. The goal of the 2014 CPS Reference Architectures Workshop was to help identify elements of CPS reference architecture and an Industrial Internet "stack". Over 50 senior CPS research scientists were invited to attend teh workshop. The workshop website can be found at http://cps-vo.org/CPSReferenceArtchitectureWkshp .

7. Creation of the CPS Resources Group on teh CPS VO - The goal of the "CPS Resouces" group was created in 2015 as a gateway for users to gain quick access to all current and historical informatoin about CPS reaeach and researchers, activities, reporsts, government programs and solicitations, data, and other CPS-related programs in one centralized location. All current and past CPS workshops and their respecive artifacts can be found at http://cps-vo.org/group/cps-resources .

8.  The goal of the CPS Community Forums are to provide all CPS Week attendees with an opportunity to learn abou current and future US government and stakeholder community CPS resarch initiatives and programs such as CPS solicitations and groundbreaking community R&D projects. The 2015 CPS Community Forum at CPS Week 1025 was held on Tuesday, April 14, 2015 at the Washington State Convention Cener in Seattle Washington. Topics covered at the 2015 Forum included:CPS Community forums are organized by the community leaders and attendance is free to all CPS Week attendees, The 2015 CPS Community Forum website can be found at http://cps-vo.org/group/CPSCommunityForum2015.

9. The 2015 NSF Workshop on Big Data Analytics in CPS: Enabling the Move from IoT to Real-time Control was h eld April 2015 at CPS Week 2015 in Seatte, Washington. This workshop focused on the current state of big data real-tiem analytics (in medical, transportation (automotive, aerospace, rail), energy, and other fields); evaluated the promises and shortcomings; and evaluated what needs to be done to enable big data real-time analytics in closed-loop CPS. Workshop website:  http://cps-vo.org/group/BigDataAnalyticsinCPS2015.
